sentence: I rise today in strong support of this bill, the Quinault Indian  Nation Land Transfer Act, and I thank Chairman Westerman and Indian and  Insular Affairs Subcommittee Chairman Hurd for the opportunity to speak  about another bill…

Mr. CRANK. Mr. Speaker, I move to suspend the rules and pass the bill  (H.R. 2389) to take certain land in the State of Washington into trust  for the benefit of the Quinault Indian Nation, and for other purposes.

The Clerk read the title of the bill.

The text of the bill is as follows:                                 H.R. 2389

Be it enacted…
